description.narrative: Output based aid component to the Clean Energy Fund in ADB.
Output based aid komponent till Clean Energy Fund i ADB.

The Output-based Aid (OBA) is an instrument for Clean Energy Financing Partnership Facility (CEFPF), referring to contribution ID 51020107, aims to promote access to electricity for the poor, and mainly contributing to the achievement of the access to energy output within the CEFPF's results framework (Output 4 - Expected Access to Energy Benefits). The OBA is an approach designed to increase access to and the delivery of basic services to the poor using performance-based subsidies. OBA links the payment of a subsidy to the delivery of specific services or “outputs”. The service delivery is contracted out to a third party, the service provider who is responsible for providing the up-front financing of the contracted services until the agreed upon outputs are delivered and independently verified. The subsidy is explicitly targeted at the poor, depending on the context and the environment.

description.narrative: The intervention, Output-Based Aid (OBA), was assessed by the Unit for Loans and Guarantee of the Sida HQ. In 2013, the Agreement of CEFPF was amended to accompany the OBA financial resources. The total amount allocated to the Clean Energy Fund (under the CEFPF) was 100 MSEK and earmarked for OBA projects. In 2014, the OBA contribution was transferred to Regional Asia. As of December 2019, there are 5 OBA projects supported by the CEF. Three OBA have completed (Vietnam, Cambodia and Regional) and two are on-going (Bangladesh and Nepal). For example, the OBA project in Vietnam: Renewable Energy Development Network Expansion and Rehabilitation for Remote Communes Sections Project, at the completion, the expanded access to electricity in the targeted provinces increased the percentage of household electrification from 83.5% to 96.8%. The project impact was defined as pro-poor and balanced economic development of poor communes through the sustainable use of electricity and renewable energy. The poverty rate was reduced by about 50% in districts where access to reliable, affordable electricity have been expanded by the project and the grant at the completion. Since the OBA is an integral part of Clean Energy Fund (CEF) under the CEFPF, all administrative matters of OBA contribution are reported under the CEFPF including the performance, results, audit report, financial report and workplan. Thus, the progress of OBA will be followed-up and monitored within the CEFPF contribution (Trac ID 51020107).
